item.title: Unexpected Use of Zobrist Hashing :eyes:
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: I’m excited to share a surprising discovery I made while working on a programming assignment for the CS3230 module, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, at NUS. This revelation involves the unexpected application of Zobrist Hashing, a technique primarily designed for board games, to efficiently solve a challenging problem unrelated to gaming. Get ready for a bit of technical insight! Revisiting Zobrist Hashing 🕹️ In my previous post, I shared my experiences developing an AI agent to play the board game “Breakthrough” for the CS2109S individual project.

item.title: Modules that I have taken for each semester in NUS :eyes:
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: This is not a very formal post, just keeping track of all the modules that I have taken across the years.
